Description: An amulet pendant: the means of suspension lost, made of milky-white quartz. It is four-sided, the two longest sides convex, the upper edge concave and the lower straight but apparently broken. A groove running from the upper edge to the lower edge of the top surface divides the latter into two unequal parts. The whole pendant tapers from top to bottom.
Curator's comments: For the only comparable unbroken example see W. M. F. Petrie & J. E. Quibell, ‘Naqada and Ballas 1895’ (London, 1896), pl.LVIII, no. 17, dated by Petrie to the Twelfth Dynasty.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (199)
